intro: Chamaefistula curranii, commonly known as the Curran's thornapple, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation. Chamaefistula curranii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
